DataElement.preferredName: Primary Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Significant Overlap Nodal Radiation Field Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator of whether primary tumor centrally located less than 2 cm from involved nodal disease which would result in significant overlap of primary SBRT and nodal radiation fields.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Primary Stereotactic Body Radiation Therapy Significant Overlap Nodal Radiation Field
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.:A term applied to differences, correlations, cause-and-effect relationships, etc., to indicate that they are noticeable, probably too closely correlated to be attributed to chance and therefore indicating a systematic relation: substantial, fairly large; also having consequence or import, important in effect or meaning. In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent._The phenomenon of coinciding partially or wholly; extending over and covering a part of._Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part._The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value._Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

Concepts.definition: Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.
Stereotactic radiation therapy in which one or several maximum dose radiation treatments are delivered targeting cancers of the body, excluding the brain or spine.

In statistics significant ordinarily indicates a probability of not less than 95 percent, while highly significant indicates a probability of not less than 99 percent._The phenomenon of coinciding partially or wholly; extending over and covering a part of._Of or pertaining to a node, any bulge or swelling of an anatomical structure or part._The area of the body exposed to radiation during radiation therapy.

The phenomenon of coinciding partially or wholly; extending over and covering a part of.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/15/08 - Associated NCIt concets for Yes/No instead of Meta.  Superceded existing VD.

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the primary tumor centrally located less than 2 cm from involved nodal disease which would result in significant overlap of the primary SBRT and nodal radiation fields?
